oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ledagie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A half-length portrait, facing right, with Ledagie wearing a light blue tunic and red plumed hat.

An Upper Creek Chief, who was later associated with the Trading Post at Jacksonville, Alabama, the County seat of Benton, now Calhoun County. He was a signer of the 1839 Cession Treaty and was made an allotment under that agreement. A marker in the town square at Jacksonville is dedicated to his memory.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: McKenney, Thomas L. (Thomas Loraine), 1785-1859; Hall, James, 1793-1868
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Daniel Rice and James G. Clark
